lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
* The Deadline class represents a deadline task for the Duke program.
* It extends the SingleTask class and provides additional methods specific to deadline tasks.
* Constructs a new Deadline object with the given description and deadline.
* @param description the description of the Deadline task
* @param deadline the deadline of the Deadline task in the format "dd/MM/yyyy HHmm"
LocalDateTime dateTime = LocalDateTime.of(year, month, day, hour, minute);
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HH:mm");

* Returns the status icon of the task.
* @return a string representing the status icon of the task
* Unmarks the task as done and displays a message to the user.

* @return a string representing the task when it is removed
return "OK DONE ALR removed your Deadline ah:\n" +

* @return a string representing the task in a save file

* Flips the dialog box such that the ImageView is on the left and text on the right.

* The Duke class represents the main class for the Duke chat-bot.
* It contains the main method and handles the initialization of the chat-bot.
* Constructs a new Duke object and initializes the chat-bot.
* The DukeException class represents an exception that can be thrown by the Duke program.
* It extends the Exception class and provides a custom message to display to the user.
* Constructs a new DukeException object with the given message.
* @param message the message to display to the user
* Returns the message of the exception.
* @return a string representing the message of the exception
* The Event class represents an event task for the Duke program.
* It extends the SingleTask class and provides additional methods specific to event tasks.
* Constructs a new Event object with the given description, start time, and end time.
* @param description the description of the Event task
* @param from the start time of the Event
* @param to the end time of the Event
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

return "OK DONE ALR added your Event ah:\n" +

* @return a string representing the task in a list
return ". [E][" + getStatusIcon() + "] " + this.description +"(from: "+ this.from + " to: " + this.to + ")\n";

* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
* Controller for MainWindow. Provides the layout for the other controls.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* The Parser class represents the parser for the Duke program.
* It provides methods to parse user input and execute commands.
* Parses the given user input and executes the corresponding command.
* @param s the user input to parse
* @param taskList the TaskList object to store and manage tasks
* @throws DukeException if there is an error parsing the user input
public String parse(String s, TaskList taskList) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Boy ah need to know which one u want delete eh.");
string += String.format("\nGot %d task in list boy", taskList.taskList.size());
throw new DukeException("Boy ah need to know which one u want delete eh.");
throw new DukeException("Boy ah todo need description eh.");
throw new DukeException("Boy need to know when the deadline is eh.");
throw new DukeException("BOY AH The deadline need to write a /by time!!");
throw new DukeException("Boy need to know the event description eh.");
throw new DukeException("BOY!! The event command need /from and /to times.");
throw new DukeException("Boy idk what you saying eh must tell me todo or deadline or event :(");
return "Boy idk what you saying eh must tell me todo or deadline or event :(";
* The SingleTask class represents a single task for the Duke program.
* It is an abstract class that provides a common interface for different types of tasks.
* The Storage class represents the storage for the Duke program.
* It provides methods to save and load tasks from a file so tasks are not lost when bot is closed.
* Constructs a new Storage object with the given file path.
* @param filePath the file path to save and load tasks from
* Saves the given list of tasks to the file specified by the file path.
* @param taskList an ArrayList of SingleTask objects representing the list of tasks to save
* @throws IOException if there is an error writing to the file
public void saveTasks(ArrayList<SingleTask> taskList) throws IOException {
* Loads a list of tasks from the file specified by the file path.
* @return an ArrayList of SingleTask objects representing the list of tasks loaded from the file
* @throws IOException if there is an error reading from the file
* @throws DukeException if there is an error parsing the data in the file
public ArrayList<SingleTask> loadTasks() throws IOException, DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Invalid task type in save file");
* The TaskList class represents a list of tasks for the Duke program.
